ClipboardItem.summary: The ClipboardItem interface of the Clipboard API represents a single item format, used when reading or writing clipboard data using and respectively.

remarks.para: The ClipboardItem interface enables developers to use a single type to represent a range of different data formats.

blockquote.para: The read() and write() methods can be used to work with text strings and arbitrary data items represented by instances. However, if you are solely working with text, it is more convenient to use the and methods.

remarks.para:
-
-Clipboard API
-Image support for Async Clipboard article

ClipboardItemClipboardItem.summary: The ClipboardItem() constructor creates a new object, which represents data to be stored or retrieved via the Clipboard API and methods, respectively.

blockquote.para: The read() and write() methods can be used to work with text strings and arbitrary data items represented by instances. However, if you are solely working with text, it is more convenient to use the and methods.
Image format support varies by browser. See the browser compatibility table for the Clipboard interface.

remarks.para:
-Clipboard API
-Image support for Async Clipboard article

ClipboardItemGetType.summary: The getType() method of the interface returns a {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves with a of the requested {{Glossary("MIME type")}} or an error if the MIME type is not found.

remarks.para:
-Clipboard API
-Image support for Async Clipboard article

ClipboardItemGetType.returns: A {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves with a object.

ClipboardItemPresentationStyle.summary: The read-only presentationStyle property of the interface returns a string indicating how an item should be presented.

remarks.para: For example, in some contexts an image might be displayed inline, while in others it might be represented as an attachment.

-Clipboard API
-Image support for Async Clipboard article

ClipboardItemSupports.summary: The supports() static method of the interface returns true if the given MIME type is supported by the clipboard, and false otherwise.

remarks.para:
Note that the Clipboard API mandates support for plain text, HTML and PNG files.
The supports() method will always return true for these MIME types, so testing them is unnecessary.

-Clipboard API
-Image support for Async Clipboard article

ClipboardItemSupports.returns: true if the given MIME type is supported by the clipboard, false otherwise.

ClipboardItemTypes.summary: The read-only types property of the interface returns an {{jsxref("Array")}} of {{Glossary("MIME type", 'MIME types')}} available within the .

remarks.para:
-Clipboard API
-Image support for Async Clipboard article
